CatDescriptText: Donald Mitchell, ex-steel millworker, 290 Bonifay Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the steel strike will be resumed after the 80-day 'cooling-off' period imposed by the Supreme Court under the injection of the Taft-Hartley Act?" answer reads: "I don't think so, because I feel that there will be a settlement. Also, if there is not a settlement, I believe that the workers will not go out again.  They are all poor men, and once they get in they will stay in plants."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Donald Mitchell wearing dark hat, corduroy coat with toggle buttons, moustache, and light colored textured shirt, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
